messages.body: $TSLA http://www.cnbc.com/2017/04/18/tesla-model-x-tops-aaa-green-car-list.html

links.title: Tesla Model X tops AAA 'green car' list
links.description: Aydin Palabiyikoglu | Anadolu Agency | Getty Images Tesla's Model X SUV was the overall top pick in the Automobile Association of America's 2017 Green Car Guide. AAA testers found the car to be the best choice among the 65 cars tested, including full-battery electrics, hybrids, alternative fuel-based cars and even fuel efficient internal combustion cars.

links.title: Scott Galloway - How Amazon is Dismantling Retail
links.description: Scott Galloway speaks at L2's Amazon Clinic about how Amazon is disrupting retail. Not only has Amazon changed consumer shopping habits, it has changed the relationship between shareholders and investors. Investors are no longer satisfied with steadily growing profits; instead they seek fast growth and strong vision - even at the expense of profitability.

links.title: Saturday Night RORC: Tesla Motors
links.description: Tesla Motors, Inc. (NASDAQ: TSLA) builds cars that run on electricity and stocks that run on hype. Not that hype and speculation should be completely shunned. It's just that a portfolio can only take so much. If share ownership in Tesla Motors, Inc. included a minority interest in Space X, then I'd be excited.

links.title: Is Amazon Overvalued? Compare Price-To-Sales Ratios
links.description: The price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio is the most common and simple valuation metric to calculate for any company that has positive earnings. It is often cited to describe the attractiveness of a stock-in other words how cheap or expensive the stock is trading relative to the stock's intrinsic value.
